text:
When I have Sprint PCS Connection Manager installed on my Win2k machine, Apache 
will not start, and spams the error log with:
[Wed Dec 11 11:42:53 2002] [error] (730038)An operation was attempted on 
something that is not a socket.  : winnt_accept: AcceptEx failed. Attempting to 
recover.
[Wed Dec 11 11:42:53 2002] [error] (730038)An operation was attempted on 
something that is not a socket.  : winnt_accept: AcceptEx failed. Attempting to 
recover.
[Wed Dec 11 11:42:53 2002] [error] (730038)An operation was attempted on 
something that is not a socket.  : winnt_accept: AcceptEx failed. Attempting to 
recover.

A few times per second, as you can see from the timestamp. A link to download 
the connection manager software is:
http://205.137.195.84/servlet/Downloadpage?platform=Windows+98SE%2C+Me%2C+2000%
2C+XP&softwareItem=+PCS+Connection+Manager+%28SM%29+Software&go.x=12&go.y=13

While merely installed, and not even running, Apache 2.0.43 will not run on my 
PC. When I uninstall the connection manager, Apache works fine. Problem is, I 
need both.
creator: ed@ebonmists.com

text:
I am seeing the same, after upgrading to the latest version of BlackICE PC 
Protection software (V3.5.ceh). While this isn't a connection manager, it is a 
firewall and seems to be affecting the performance of the httpd. I'm running 
Windows XP Pro with SP1 installed.
creator: Kristian.Bergmann@nvg.org
Kristian.Bergmann@nvg.org
text:
Related to my previous comment, here's a run-down of the changes revisions, 
found at http://blackice.iss.net/update_center/readme_pcp.txt :

BlackICE 3.5.ceh (this release)

 - Resolved issues in the SOCKS and VNC parsers
 - Enhanced bisensor to reload when a change occurs in the configuration
   files
 - Resolved issue in the driver that caused BSOD in some systems running
   Seibel applications or Cisco router configuration changes using telnet
 - Resolved the issue where No Adapters could be opened with ICE Adapter 
   added.
 - Enhanced the VPN API
 - Resolved an installation issue if the install path is greater than 27 
   characters.
 - Resolved crash in ProUtil when baselining large files.
 - Resolved the issue where the BlackICE shortcut icons are not displayed
   in WinXP.

I was excited to see Apache 2.0.44 and hoped it would fix the problem. It did. 
Kind of. The error messages are no longer there, but with the Sprint PCS 
connection manager installed, Apache chugs my CPU at 99-100% usage. No errors 
in the log, no disk activity, but 100% CPU usage. I uninstall the connection 
manager, and it works fine. Thought you'd like an update.
creator: ed@ebonmists.com

text:
I am getting the same response (or lack thereof) as Ed. I've already noted this 
(and possibly also why) in bug #16327. Just thought I'd be consistent and 
address the same here.
creator: Kristian.Bergmann@nvg.org

text:
Can you please try this with 2.0.50?

Try adding "Win32DisableAcceptex" to your configuration file.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
